info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 3:56PM EDT until August 07 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MCDOWELL...MITCHELL...CALDWELL...AVERY...NORTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE...YANCEY AND NORTHWESTERN BURKE COUNTIES... At 356 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Blowing Rock to 7 miles west of Lenoir to 7 miles east of Marion, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Newland, Gamewell, Cajah`s Mountain, Glen Alpine, Banner Elk, Elk Park and Bakersville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for western North Carolina. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western North Carolina. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
